concept.title: Web Beacon
concept.shortdesc: A web beacon, also known as a clear.gif, is a transparent graphic image, no larger than 1x1 pixel. It is placed on a web site or in an email to track visitor behavior. The web beacon points to a server, known as 2o7.net, to retrieve the image. The image, when loaded into the user's browser, loads JavaScript code that performs several functions, one of which is to check for a cookie. If a cookie is not loaded, it loads one on the browser. If the user does not have cookies enabled, a web beacon cannot track activity. The web beacon for a non-cookied user accounts for an anonymous visit, but the user's unique information is not recorded. The JavaScript code also collects variables (particular to the selected web site) from the code and sends them to analytics reporting.
